newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia peso gains 3.3 vs dlr, further rises seen.
newsitem.headline: Colombia peso gains 3.3 vs dlr, further rises seen.

text.p: Colombia's peso gained 3.3 to close at 1,071 pesos against the dollar as industry ploughed export earnings into the markets and converted dollar-denominated debts.
Some banks also moved to shorten dollar positions to make up for peso shortfalls, interbank traders said.
Traders said Friday's decision by Washington to "decertify" Colombia as an ally in the drug war for a second consecutive year was widely expected and had no impact.
Dealers reported operations worth a total $126.8 million. The peso sank to an intraday low of 1,078 to the dollar before moving to close at the high.
Traders said they expected the peso to continue climbing in the coming days as export earnings and private sector foreign debt flow into the markets.

In its weekly report the influential National Association of Financial Institutions (ANIF) said it expected peso illiquidity, the absence of speculation about the U.S. decertification decision and the rise in short term interest rates to push down the value of the dollar.
ANIF estimated Colombia would accumulate at least a further $600 million in foreign reserves in 1997.
